result.execSummary:
The defendant Irina P Kolenkina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Russian
Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall turn over any passports to Dane County Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of release.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Interpreter Yurk Rashkin appeared.    The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts. 
The defendant will need a RUSSIAN interpreter for future court appearances.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall turn over any passports to Dane County Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of release.
